img.alt: Graph showing a movement trail from a random walk simulation.

td.p: This lecture completes the introduction of classes by showing a way to implement user-defined iterators. It then discusses simulation models, and illustrates some of the ideas underlying simulations modeling by simulating a random walk.

p.em: Image courtesy of donovanbeeson on Flickr.

div.p: A function that remembers the point in the function body where it last returned a value and the values of all local variables.

html.p: What is the difference between yield and return?

div.p: When yield is used, the state of the function is not lost.
A model is a theoretical construct that will provide useful information about the possible behaviors of the system being modeled.

html.p: In problem set 5, you will build a program to monitor news feeds over the Internet. Your program will filter the news, alerting the user when it notices a news story that matches that user's interests (for example, the user may be interested in a notification whenever a story related to the Red Sox is posted).

ul.li: Code Files (ZIP) (This file contains 1 .txt file, 3 .pyc files, and 6 .py files.)

html.p: Problem set 6 is assigned in this session. The instructions and solutions can be found on the session page where it is due, Lecture 14 Sampling and Monte Carlo Simulation.
